While it is true that society has made significant progress in accepting new discoveries and scientific progress, there still exists some level of opposition and resistance to change. However, it is safe to say that compared to the time of the Scientific Revolution, the opposition to scientific discoveries is much less pronounced and more scholars, scientists and researchers are encouraged and celebrated for their work.

That being said, scientific advancements continue to challenge the traditional worldview and challenge long-held beliefs, such as the beliefs surrounding climate change, genetic engineering or artificial intelligence, and this can lead to controversies and resistance to new ideas. However, it remains a hallmark of modern, forward-thinking societies that they are open to change and progress, and ultimately embrace new advancements and technologies that can revolutionize our world.
